Interface VirtualServer

All Known Subinterfaces:
VirtualServerRMI
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericClient, GenericClientExtended, RMIClient, RMIServer, SocketClient
public interface VirtualServer

  • Method Details

    • createGame

      void createGame(int level, UUID id, int numplayrs, String Nickname) throws Exception
      Creates a new game with the specified level, ID, number of players, and nickname.
      Parameters:
      level - the level of the game
      id - the unique identifier for the game
      numplayrs - the number of players participating in the game
      Nickname - the nickname assigned to the game or host player
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during game creation

    • JoinGame

      void JoinGame(String NickName, int NumOfPlayers, UUID id, UUID oldid) throws IOException
      Allows a player to join an existing game on the server using their nickname and identifiers.
      Parameters:
      NickName - The nickname of the player joining the game.
      NumOfPlayers - The number of players already in the game.
      id - The unique identifier of the game the player is joining.
      oldid - The unique identifier representing the most recent game state or player's previous connection.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output error occurs.

    • activateTimer

      void activateTimer(String player, UUID id) throws IOException
      Activates a timer for a specific player in the game identified by the given UUID.
      Parameters:
      player - The name of the player for whom the timer will be activated.
      id - The unique identifier of the game in which the timer is being activated.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the timer activation process.

    • setNumTile

      void setNumTile(int playerid, int posTile, UUID id) throws IOException
      Sets the number tile on the playerâ€™s board in the specified position.
      Parameters:
      playerid - The ID of the player whose board is being modified.
      posTile - The position on the board where the tile is to be placed.
      id - The unique identifier of the game session.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output error occurs during the operation.

    • Surrend

      void Surrend(int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to surrender in the current game session.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player surrendering
      id - the unique game session identifier
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the surrender process

    • visualizeFinalScores

      void visualizeFinalScores(UUID id) throws IOException
      Visualizes the final scores of the game identified by the unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier (UUID) of the game for which the final scores are to be visualized.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs during the process.

    • pickTileAlreadyFlipped

      void pickTileAlreadyFlipped(int index, int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to pick a tile that has already been flipped during the game.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the tile to be picked.
      playerID - The unique identifier of the player attempting to pick the tile.
      id - The unique game session identifier.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the tile-picking action.

    • pickTileUnknown

      void pickTileUnknown(int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to pick an unknown tile associated with the specified game session.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The unique identifier of the player attempting to pick the tile.
      id - The unique identifier of the game session.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs during the operation.

    • pickLittleDeck

      void pickLittleDeck(int index, int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to pick a "little deck" during the game. The little deck is associated with a specific index and player ID within an ongoing game identified by the UUID.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the little deck to be picked
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      id - the unique identifier of the game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while performing the action

    • depositLittleDeck

      void depositLittleDeck(int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows the player to deposit their little deck in the game by specifying their unique player ID and game session ID.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      id - the unique identifier of the game session in which the action is performed
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the process

    • depositTile

      void depositTile(int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to deposit a tile during the game.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      id - the unique identifier of the game
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs during the operation

    • endbuilding

      void endbuilding(int PlayerID, int positionwheretogo, UUID id) throws IOException
      Ends the building phase for a player and transitions to the specified position.
      Parameters:
      PlayerID - The unique identifier for the player ending the building phase.
      positionwheretogo - The position or phase to transition to after ending the building phase.
      id - The unique game session identifier.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs.

    • insertTile

      void insertTile(int row, int col, int playerID, int rotation, UUID id) throws IOException
      Inserts a tile into the specified position on the game board with the given rotation.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index where the tile should be inserted
      col - the column index where the tile should be inserted
      playerID - the ID of the player inserting the tile
      rotation - the rotation to be applied to the tile before insertion
      id - the unique identifier for the current game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an issue during the insertion process

    • EffectActivation

      void EffectActivation(UUID id) throws IOException
      Activates a specific effect within the virtual server using the provided unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier (UUID) of the effect to be activated
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the effect activation process

    • getCardinuse

      void getCardinuse(UUID id) throws IOException
      Retrieves the card currently in use for a given game instance identified by the provided UUID.
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier (UUID) associated with the game instance for which the current card in use needs to be retrieved.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs during the operation.

    • chooseOneSubShip

      void chooseOneSubShip(int index, int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to choose a specific sub-ship in the game.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the sub-ship being selected
      playerID - the unique identifier for the player making the selection
      id - the unique identifier for the game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

    • acceptToLandOnAPlanet

      void acceptToLandOnAPlanet(String p, boolean yOn, int NumPlanet, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to decide whether to accept or reject the opportunity to land on a planet.
      Parameters:
      p - The player's identifier or name involved in the decision to land on the planet.
      yOn - A boolean flag indicating the player's choice. True if the player accepts the landing, false otherwise.
      NumPlanet - The number representing the specific planet on which the player has the option to land.
      id - A unique identifier (UUID) for the game session or player context.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs during the process.

    • chooseAbandonedStation

      void chooseAbandonedStation(String player, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows the player to interact with an abandoned station, specifying their preferences for handling the scenario.
      Parameters:
      player - the name or identifier of the player interacting with the abandoned station
      yOn - a boolean indicating whether the player agrees to proceed with the interaction
      storageTiles - a list of storage tiles represented as a list of lists of integers, where each sublist corresponds to a specific storage configuration
      newGoods - a list of goods sets represented as a list of lists, where each sublist contains Goods objects
      id - the unique identifier of the game or session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during the interaction process

    • chooseCannonBatteryPos

      void chooseCannonBatteryPos(String player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to select the positions for cannon batteries during the game.
      Parameters:
      player - the name or identifier of the player who is making the selection
      cannonPos - an ArrayList of ArrayLists containing the positions of cannons on the player's ship
      batteriesPos - an ArrayList of ArrayLists containing the positions of batteries on the ship
      id - the unique identifier for the game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output operation is failed or interrupted

    • chooseHowToFaceMeteors

      void chooseHowToFaceMeteors(String player, ArrayList<Integer> howToDefenceFromShots, UUID id) throws IOException
      Determines how the player chooses to defend against meteors in a game.
      Parameters:
      player - the nickname of the player making the decision
      howToDefenceFromShots - a list of integers representing the player's strategy or actions to defend against meteor threats
      id - the unique identifier of the game instance
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs

    • choosePassengersToLose

      void choosePassengersToLose(String p, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> pass, UUID id) throws IOException
      Handles the process of choosing passengers to lose in a particular scenario determined by the game's logic and state.
      Parameters:
      p - The player's identifier or name involved in the action.
      yOn - A boolean flag indicating the current state or condition (e.g., a validation check or action toggle).
      pass - A list of lists representing groups of passengers and their respective data, where each inner list might contain specific passenger-related information.
      id - A unique identifier for the game instance, used for correlating the action within the context of the ongoing game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O-related error occurs during the execution of this method.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      void chooseToClaimReward(boolean yOn, String player, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to claim a reward in the game, with the option to confirm or deny the action.
      Parameters:
      yOn - A boolean value indicating whether the player chooses to claim the reward.
      player - The nickname or identifier of the player performing the action.
      id - The unique identifier for the game session or instance where the action takes place.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the process of claiming the reward.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      void chooseToClaimReward(boolean yOn, String player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows the player to choose whether to claim a reward. This involves processing the player's decision alongside their storage tiles and new goods.
      Parameters:
      yOn - a boolean value indicating the player's decision to claim the reward.
      player - a String representing the player's name making the decision.
      storageTiles - an ArrayList of ArrayLists containing integers that represent the current state of the player's storage tiles.
      newGoods - an ArrayList of ArrayLists containing Goods objects, representing the new goods available for claiming.
      id - a UUID that uniquely identifies the game session.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs during the operation.

    • chooseToPlaceBatteries

      void chooseToPlaceBatteries(String p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posBatAndNumBattXPos, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows the player to choose and place batteries at specified positions during the game.
      Parameters:
      p - the player identifier or name making the selection
      posBatAndNumBattXPos - a 2D list where each sublist contains the positions and the corresponding number of batteries to place
      id - the unique identifier associated with the current game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the process

    • chooseToStartFirePower

      void chooseToStartFirePower(String p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> DoubFireTriplets, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BatteriesToAct, UUID id) throws IOException
      Initiates firepower in the game based on the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      p - The player's identifier engaged in firepower activation.
      DoubFireTriplets - A list of triplets specifying the coordinates and parameters for double-fire actions.
      BatteriesToAct - A list of positions indicating which batteries should participate in the action.
      id - The unique identifier of the game session.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input-output operation fails during execution.

    • chooseToStartMotor

      void chooseToStartMotor(String player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginesPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows the player to initiate the process of starting a motor, specifying the positions of engines and batteries to be used.
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player requesting to start the motor
      enginesPos - a 2D list containing the positions of the engines to be activated
      batteriesPos - a 2D list containing the positions of the batteries to power the engines
      id - the unique identifier for the current game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

    • chooseWhereToPutGoods

      void chooseWhereToPutGoods(String player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posGoods, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> goodsSets, UUID id) throws IOException
      Allows a player to choose positions to store goods in the game. The method interacts with goods and their corresponding positions to allocate them appropriately in the game context.
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player making the selection
      posGoods - a nested list of integers representing possible positions for the goods
      goodsSets - a nested list of Goods objects to be allocated across the specified positions
      id - a universally unique identifier (UUID) associated with the current game session
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

    • addWaitTile

      void addWaitTile(int playerID, UUID id) throws IOException
      Adds a "wait tile" for the specified player in the game identified by the given UUID.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the player who is adding the wait tile
      id - the unique identifier of the game
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the operation

    • insertWaitTile

      void insertWaitTile(int playerID, int index, int row, int col, int rotation, UUID id) throws IOException
      Inserts a wait tile into the specified position and orientation on the board for a given player.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The ID of the player who is inserting the wait tile.
      index - The index of the wait tile to be inserted.
      row - The row on the board where the wait tile should be placed.
      col - The column on the board where the wait tile should be placed.
      rotation - The rotation of the wait tile to be applied before placement.
      id - The unique identifier of the game in which the tile is being inserted.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while performing the operation.

    • CommandFillTile

      void CommandFillTile(int playerid, boolean wantalien, AlienColor color, int row, int col, UUID id) throws IOException
      Fills a tile on the board for a specific player based on the given parameters. The tile can optionally be populated with an alien of a specified color.
      Parameters:
      playerid - The unique identifier of the player making the command.
      wantalien - A boolean indicating if the tile should contain an alien.
      color - The color of the alien to be placed, if applicable.
      row - The row index where the tile is to be placed.
      col - The column index where the tile is to be placed.
      id - The unique game session identifier.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the tile placement.

    • activeGames

      void activeGames(UUID uuid) throws IOException
      Activates all ongoing games associated with the specified UUID.
      Parameters:
      uuid - the unique identifier of the game server or session for which active games need to be processed
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input-output exception occurs during the activation of games

    • demoGame

      void demoGame(UUID uuid) throws IOException
      Demonstrates a game associated with the given unique identifier (UUID).
      Parameters:
      uuid - The unique identifier of the game to be demonstrated.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during the demonstration process.
